definition: to leave/to walk away/to beat it/to move aside
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: She tries to back track, but the President simply walks away.
sentences.chinese: 她試圖重新回到話題，但總統一言不發地走開了。

sentences.english: He snorted indignantly and walked away.
sentences.chinese: 他氣憤地哼了一聲，走開了。

sentences.english: She is a great fool for going away, if she liked him.
sentences.chinese: 要是她喜歡他而又走開，那真是個大傻瓜呢。

sentences.english: Turned free and easy of go away, let figure burger in your mind.
sentences.chinese: 轉身灑脫的走開，讓你的頭腦中留下美圖漢堡的印象。

sentences.english: But, to his dismay, the donkey walks away.
sentences.chinese: 但是，使他驚愕的是，那頭驢走開了。

sentences.english: Then, she walks away, her job done.
sentences.chinese: 然後她會走開，她的使命完成了。

sentences.english: Ying falsely claim is the waiter here, then panic away.
sentences.chinese: 珠英謊稱自己是這裏的服務員，便驚慌的走開了。

sentences.english: He might go of his own movement, but wouldn't be dismissed.
sentences.chinese: 他可以自動走開，但不能被攆走。

sentences.english: I put the pot on the gas-oven, and got away.
sentences.chinese: 我把壺放在煤氣竈上，然後就走開把這件事忘掉了。

sentences.english: Feeling he was not wanted, he walked away looking embarrassed.
sentences.chinese: 他覺得沒趣，只好訕訕地走開了。

sentences.english: I used to busk, but I was always being moved on by the police.
sentences.chinese: 我以前常在街頭賣藝，但警察總是命令我走開。

sentences.english: Captain Gordon was hurried off before I walked to him.
sentences.chinese: 在我走向戈登上尉之前，他就匆匆走開了。

sentences.english: Lady Furness left us and we began to talk .
sentences.chinese: 弗內斯勳爵夫人走開了，我們交談起來。

sentences.english: He excused himself for a moment, then came back with mobile phone in hand.
sentences.chinese: 他致歉走開了片刻，回來時手裏拿着手機。

sentences.english: He steeled his heart and went out.

definition: to despise/to disdain/to look down upon
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
(typically followed by 就[jiu4]) apt to (lose one's temper, catch a cold etc)/at the drop of a hat
to turn one's head/to turn around
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to be made to stand still as a punishment
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
